channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Nearly 4,000 NASA employees opt to leave agency through deferred resignation program
item.description: The employees who have chosen to leave the agency amount to about 20% of NASA's workforce.

item.title: A man accused of stabbing 11 people at a Walmart is in Michigan authorities' custody
item.description: Eleven people were stabbed at a Walmart in Traverse City on Saturday — with six in critical condition — in what a Michigan sheriff said appeared to be...

item.title: The Case of the Black Swan (Part 1)
item.description: A former ballerina shoots her husband. Did she kill to save herself or was it out of spite? "48 Hours" contributor Jim Axelrod reports in part one of ...

item.title: "48 Hours" Live to Tell: The Vendetta
item.description: A judge and her son are ambushed in front of their home. Shot multiple times, the judge refuses to be intimidated and works to stop other attacks. CBS...

item.title: Israel says it has dropped aid into Gaza
item.description: The IDF says seven packages with flour, sugar, and canned food were delivered to Gaza, amid a growing hunger crisis there.

item.title: What led a former ballerina to fatally shoot her husband?
item.description: Ashley Benefield, dubbed the "Black Swan," took the stand in her own defense during her trial for the murder of her estranged husband. Prosecutors say...

item.title: Europe accused of going soft on Azerbaijan to avoid buying Russian gas
item.description: Critics say EU policy has given Azerbaijan's President Ilham Aliyev a free hand during his crackdown on opponents.

item.title: Greece battles wildfires, evacuating residents near Athens
item.description: Residents just 30km away from Athens have fled their homes, as Greece's temperatures are forecast to reach 44C on Sunday.

item.title: The last custodian: A Kashmiri artisan's battle to save a musical legacy
item.description: Ghulam Mohammed Zaz fears for the future of the hand-made santoor as there are no takers for the dying artform.

item.title: American Airlines jet at Denver International evacuated due to landing gear incident
item.description: Video posted to social media showed passengers evacuating the aircraft using a slide as smoke and flames billowed from below the rear of the plane.

item.title: Renaming of military bases stirs debate over Confederate ties
The Case of the Black Swan (Part 2)
item.description: The former ballerina dubbed "The Black Swan” tells her story of why she shot and killed her estranged husband. "48 Hours" contributor Jim Axelrod repo...

item.title: Thailand and Cambodia thank Trump for mediation, but shelling continues
item.description: As he golfs in Scotland, the US president talks to the Thai and Cambodian leaders about a ceasefire.

item.title: What's at stake with the European Union-U.S. trading partnership if a tariff deal isn't reached
item.description: As the deadline for the start of 30 percent tariffs on the EU, Cecilia Malmstrom, former European Commissioner for Trade, explains the scope and scale...

item.title: Israel's military says aid airdrops will begin in Gaza as hunger grows
item.description: Israel's military said the airdrops would begin Saturday night in Gaza, after mounting accounts of starvation-related deaths. Israeli officials also s...

item.title: Taiwanese political gridlock endures as China-friendly party survives recall vote
item.description: A months-long recall effort to oust lawmakers considered pro-Chinese has failed in the self-governing island's legislature.

item.title: Official fired during Trump’s first term appointed president of embattled US Institute of Peace
Immigration judges fired by Trump administration say they will fight back
item.description: Federal immigration judges fired by the Trump administration are filing appeals, pursuing legal action and speaking out in an unusually public campaig...
